reviews.title: What You Should Know Before Signing Up – Why I No Longer Trust Kickstart Interview
reviews.text:
They Promised What They Didn’t Have – Please Be very Cautious

If you're planning to pay thousands for Kickstart Interview, please be very careful.

They sold me a premium coaching package promising tailored mentorship for FAANG interviews — none of which actually existed. As soon as I paid, the support vanished. Meetings were missed, communication was unreliable, and the “tailored” part turned out to be empty words.

⚠️ Important: If they promise anything, don’t take it at face value. If it’s not clearly written in the contract or documented in writing, do NOT sign or pay.

Once they have your money, you're left with poor support, missed calls, and empty promises.

Ask questions, ask for proof, and don’t trust verbal assurances. I wish someone had warned me — so I’m doing that now.

reviews.title: Interview Kickstart feedback
reviews.text:
I completed the Interview Kickstart Full stack program and currently pursuing Advance Gen AI program, and overall, I'm happy with the experience. The program is well-structured and targets the key areas needed for technical interviews, including data structures, algorithms, and system design. The instructors are knowledgeable, and the mock interviews provided invaluable practice and feedback. It prepares you for interviews within a reasonable time frame. You can retake the course and attend doubt-clearing sessions, which is great for reinforcing what you've learned.

The program's pace is fast, so you need to be ready to dedicate significant time and effort. It's also on the pricier side, which might be a consideration for some.

You could prepare for FAANG interviews on your own, but it might take longer, and you could miss out on a structured approach. Interview Kickstart provides that structure and mock interview sessions, which is really helpful.

reviews.title: Navigating the Tech Job Market: A Review of IK’s Early Engineering Program
reviews.text:
After completing my CS master's degree, I faced significant challenges entering the software engineering job market. Despite my efforts, I struggled with technical interviews and couldn't advance past the initial application stages. My background did not originally include computer science, and my academic focus did not cover the nuances of coding interviews, like those you find on LeetCode.

Recognizing my gaps, I hesitantly joined IK's early engineering program, which turned out to be a pivotal decision. The program, especially the live DSA sessions led by Omkar and the recorded content, were instrumental. Omkar's deep understanding and clear explanations of data structures and algorithms made complex concepts accessible. Additionally, the mock interviews were invaluable; they not only improved my technical skills using C++ but also taught me how to articulate my thought process effectively during interviews.

Sanjeev Qazi, in particular, played a crucial role in enhancing my interview techniques, while my Career Transformation Manager, Snehil Kaushik, provided exceptional guidance in optimizing my resume and honing my responses to behavioral questions.

The comprehensive support from IK prepared me well for the job market, leading to multiple job offers, including one from Meta. I am immensely grateful for the growth in my problem-solving abilities and interviewing skills, all thanks to my experience at IK.

With all these said, I want to emphasize that achieving these results requires considerable effort, almost akin to a full-time job. Joining IK doesn't guarantee success on its own; it provides the resources and support needed, but it’s your hard work that will ultimately make you successful.

reviews.title: Comprehensive Program for Career Growth and Interview Success
reviews.text:
Interview Kickstart is an excellent program for anyone looking to level up their career and excel in technical interviews. The lectures are insightful, and the material provided for coding is truly world-class. The system design content and problems are comprehensive and invaluable for mastering this critical area.

The program also offers an in-depth guide for behavioral interviews and manager interviews, which helped me approach these conversations with confidence. The operations team is incredibly responsible and supportive throughout the process.

Mock interview sessions are a standout feature, providing realistic simulations of actual interviews, in-depth guidance, and actionable feedback. Additionally, the strong and helpful alumni association ensures you’re supported even after completing the program.

The machine learning module is another highlight—it thoroughly covers the fundamentals and basics needed to be a strong engineer. The curriculum is detailed and incredibly well-structured, perfect for anyone looking to deepen their ML expertise.

Overall, Interview Kickstart is a fantastic resource for interview preparation, job search, and career growth. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Full Stack Program
reviews.text:
I enrolled in the Full Stack Program at IK. The course materials are well-structured, comprehensive, and thoughtfully prepared. The team of instructors is comprised of professionals from top-tier companies, who deliver the content in a clear and accessible manner, helping students understand all the nuances and address any questions that arise during the learning process.

A significant emphasis is placed on preparing students for interviews, including highlighting critical nuances, explaining what interviewers typically expect to hear, and how best to approach and solve different types of problems. The IK team is highly responsive and goes above and beyond to support students in successfully completing the program.

When I had to pause my studies and fell behind the schedule due to personal circumstances, the IK team was very understanding of my situation and provided me with the opportunity to complete my program, for which I am deeply grateful.

Overall, I have very positive impressions of my experience with IK, and I greatly appreciate their professionalism and support.

reviews.title: Review on Step up program
reviews.text:
I took IK Step Up Program with Backend Engineering, the main purpose of which was to improve my coding skills and prepare for a coding test interview.
My coding skills improved a lot through this program, as I had previously studied coding through other problem-solving platforms without understanding. Thanks to IK program's effective curriculum, I learned the knowledge behind different algorithms in depth. The instructor has a deep knowledge of computer science and explains it well, making it easy for me to understand things that I didn't understand before. There are selected exercises for every topic. Some of the problems are very difficult and not easy to solve just by listening to the lectures, but there are developers' problem solving lectures for each problem and you can understand and solve the difficult problems by watching them.
The lectures are great, but the most valuable part of the program is the mock interviews. Getting feedback from real engineers working in the big techs is an experience that you can never get on your own. You get 10 mock interviews in the program, so you can practice through them and get a much better result if you get a real interview.
Lastly, IK's program requires a large time commitment. It's very hard to study all the content. I didn't watch all the content either, but I tried to watch the important ones and that alone was a big improvement. I think this program will be very effective if you have enough time to do it.

reviews.title: This Advanced AI/Machine Learning…
reviews.text:
This Advanced AI/Machine Learning Course Curriculum is truly exceptional and deserves a glowing 5-star review. Here's a comprehensive review highlighting its strengths:

1. Unparalleled Depth and Breadth

This course offers an incredibly comprehensive curriculum that covers all aspects of AI and machine learning. From foundational Python skills to advanced topics like Reinforcement Learning through Human Feedback, it leaves no stone unturned. The progression from basics to cutting-edge concepts is well-structured, ensuring us build a solid foundation before tackling complex subjects.

2. Industry-Relevant Content

The curriculum is clearly designed with real-world applications in mind. It includes crucial topics like MLOps, model deployment, and failure analysis – skills that are highly sought after in the industry. The inclusion of computer vision, NLP, and generative AI ensures us are well-versed in the most current and in-demand areas of AI.

3. Hands-On Learning

One of the standout features of this course is its emphasis on practical, hands-on experience. Multiple mini-projects and a capstone project allow us to apply our knowledge to real-world scenarios, bridging the gap between theory and practice. This approach is invaluable for developing the problem-solving skills needed in the field.

4. Interview Preparation

The course goes above and beyond by including a comprehensive interview preparation section. This covers not only technical aspects like data structures and algorithms but also software system design and AI/ML-specific interview questions. The addition of career and behavioral sessions is a thoughtful touch that prepares us holistically for the job market.

5. Expert Mentorship

The inclusion of AI mentorship from FAANG companies is a game-changer. This provides us with invaluable insights into industry practices and networking opportunities that can significantly boost our careers.

6. Well-Paced Learning

The course is well-paced, allocating appropriate time for each section. The 6-month deep dive into Machine Learning Engineering allows for thorough exploration of complex topics, while the interview preparation sections are concise yet comprehensive.

In conclusion, this Advanced AI/Machine Learning Course Curriculum is an outstanding program that offers a perfect blend of theoretical knowledge and practical skills. Its comprehensive coverage, industry relevance, and focus on career preparation make it an excellent choice for anyone looking to excel in the field of AI and machine learning. It's rare to find a course that so thoroughly prepares us for both the technical challenges and career aspects of the field. This curriculum truly deserves a 5-star rating and comes highly recommended for aspiring AI professionals like us.

Now, I’m looking to level up again, this time focusing on transitioning from DevOps to MLOps. reviews.title: The DSA program is very well…
reviews.text:
The DSA program is very well structured. Just the video content alone is comprehensive enough that you will probably not need to reach for resources outside of the platform. The instructors are incredibly patient, well versed in the content they teach, and answer any questions related to the topic and their experiences. To top it off, you will have access to a very strong support period where you can access a wide variety of AMAs, technical and career coaching, and mock interviews.

One thing I will say is the Front End program (video content) seemed less structured and comprehensive than the DSA program. Perhaps because the ecosystem is changing often, not sure. Here I began to find myself having to reach for resources outside of the program. Of course, there are still a lot of resources in terms of support and instructor access.

Overall, if you can afford to, and put the time in, you will be happy with the results. This is a kind of program where you will get what you put in, and they will give you resources and support for your effort. You (probably) cannot take this program, put minimal effort in, and expect to gain meaningful results. It's not magic. It will depend on your effort, and this program will teach a lot of useful patterns to approach technical and behavioral problems that will give life to your effort.

Shout out for Ajita Singh, my career coach, for making time for me outside her schedule and being pretty helpful.

PSA -- students don't get rewarded for reviews, but the company does apparently tie career coach's comp to positive reviews for the company on this site. I'm writing this because my career coach asked me to write a 5 star review and indirectly requested I say 5 instead of 4 (since I'd have given a 4 star review without that). I think if you are serious about furthering your career, the Interview Kickstart program is the place to do it. Like any technical training, you will get what you put in. reviews.title: Early Engineering review
reviews.text:
I did the 2 month Early Engineering program starting in October 2023 and am almost at the end of my support period, which was supposed to be 6 months long but was extended three times because of a death in my family, a hurricane, and carpal tunnel syndrome. They have been very helpful with that.

Overall, it is pricey but if you have the money and decide to do it, it is very helpful. For me, a guided structure always helps me stick to something, and I followed it as best as I could for nearly the first 2 months. The weekly cycle was: Class on Sunday (4+ hours), assignments to do (coding problems usually equivalent to medium or hard LeetCode questions, thorough video lectures, quizzes), and a coding test on Thursday (1 hour, 2-3 medium programming questions) followed by a lecture and discussion on it. That is for the first 5 weeks, then the next 3 weeks are for non-technical job searching skills. I got a job thanks to a cousin's referral near the end of that 2 months. I got let go after 4 months though so I am now making the most of my support period and all the resources and coaches are still there to help me.

The most helpful things to me have been: lots of education, practice, and discussion on LeetCode style problems, followed by thorough strategies for job hunting, coding and behavioral interviewing skills, resume, finding referrals, negotiation, etc. They offer live 1:1 coaching and lots of sessions for various topics like coding problems, resume review, interviewing skills, strategy for reaching out to recruiters and aplying, and AMAs.

Their support always responds within a day and are usually very helpful, including coding and technical questions as well as general issues.

I have gained a lot of value from the program and would recommend it. The most valuable things to me were the mock interviews, frequent technical preparation, thorough technical videos (comparable to Salman Khan's videos from Khan Academy), resume reviews, and walkthroughs and guidance on applying for jobs, and their career workbook (which is an excel document that guided me on thinking about my ideal job, exploring job options available, and preparing for behavioral interviews) all with the help of professional and experienced people from big companies.

TL;DR: In summary, it is pricey, but if you do it, it offers good and structured technical and non-technical preparation and professional guidance and opinions.

IK Support Team takes any request on priority and provides a resolution in 24 hrs where possible. On top of that SSA(Student Success Advisers) are allocated to each learner who guide and assist throughout the support period of 6 month to ensure success of Students. IK Sales Team could do better job in guiding through the right program based on the roles. Learners looking for Lead/engineering manager roles should opt for programs accordingly.

I would recommend IK if you want to land a better job through a systematic approach!

reviews.title: A Comprehensive Journey
reviews.text:
Joining Interview Kickstarter (IK) was a decision influenced by the positive outcomes I witnessed within my professional circle. Initially enrolling in the Backend Engineers domain to expand my front-end skills into more comprehensive roles post-COVID layoffs, IK offered more than I anticipated, prompting me to continue with their Applied GenAI course. This course not only taught the history of AI and the architectures behind mainstream commercial LLMs but also provided hands-on AI project experiences to deepen my understanding.

The breadth and depth of the curriculum extended into cloud-native systems design, significantly surpassing my initial expectations. However, IK’s impact wasn’t limited to the educational content. The program excels in creating a vibrant community, offering a sense of belonging and a robust support network which were surprising yet invaluable benefits. From one-on-one mock interviews—though these come with a time limit post-completion—to resume workshops and intensive technical interview preparation, IK’s offerings are comprehensive.

The career services at IK are varied, including professional development through behavioral interview practice, technical interviews, resume workshops, an internal job board, and referrals. This holistic approach is ideal for anyone seeking to make a substantial shift in their tech career or elevate their current trajectory.

Despite the comprehensive resources, landing a role remains challenging, and IK has been supportive, addressing my concerns and aiding wherever possible. However, it’s crucial to note that IK is not a magic solution. The workload is intense, akin to compressing a four-year degree into just four months, which can be overwhelming at times.

Due to the demanding nature of the curriculum, I would hesitate to recommend IK to someone without a STEM background. The program is rigorous, and even students with CS degrees and prior engineering experience find it challenging.

In summary, while IK provides extensive technical training and a supportive community, the true effectiveness of the program will ultimately be measured by the career advancements of its alumni. As I continue to navigate my professional path, IK’s comprehensive suite of career services and the community I’ve become part of are invaluable assets I’ll continue to rely on.

reviews.title: Experience with IK

I gave 4 stars because it has a tight timeline to catch up with their schedule. So, it would be a bit difficult to catch up with your current company's work and also difficult to catch up with those remaining tasks in the support period. It would be great if they could increase their support period, and relax their schedule or provide more flexibility for the working people.

reviews.title: should be part of every university

I started with the Interview Kickstarter Machine Learning Levelup Program, which helped me get my new job. Many times, we think that solving LeetCode or any other platform would help us get through the coding interview. However, we forget to learn the basics, and that is what the Interview Kickstarter teaches. They help build the foundation that not only helps during the interview (in case something is asked that you have not seen before) but also helps you thrive throughout your career.

reviews.title: Interview Kickstart (IK) is an…
reviews.text:
Interview Kickstart (IK) is an outstanding program that goes beyond expectations. The community is filled with top-tier experts who are genuinely dedicated to helping you secure a position at leading companies, including FAANG. The personalized support is exceptional, whether it's through answering questions, offering tailored advice, or providing invaluable 1:1 coaching sessions.

While IK may not offer the deep, foundational knowledge of a formal degree, it shines in its ability to connect you with industry professionals and provide practical, real-world insights. In today’s rapidly evolving job market, this hands-on approach is invaluable for staying ahead and accelerating your learning.

For those with over a decade of experience, IK is perfect for refreshing and enhancing your skills. The program's focus on contemporary trends, like AI, ensures you're always equipped with the latest knowledge. If you're looking to elevate your career and navigate the complexities of today’s tech industry, IK is an excellent choice!

reviews.title: Unlocking Success: My Transformative Journey with Interview Kickstart's TPM Program
reviews.text:
Joining Interview Kickstart's Technical Program Manager cohort was a game-changing decision for my career. From the outset, Interview Kickstart addressed my interview anxieties by providing structured and strategic guidance on how to tackle the complex landscape of technical program management interviews. The courses are designed not just to enhance skills but to boost confidence through rigorous mock interviews and engaging real-world projects. This holistic approach is crucial for anyone looking to master the interview process in high-stakes environments.

What sets Interview Kickstart apart is its robust support system and the emphasis on practical outcomes. The instructors are deeply committed, and their expertise is evident in how they tailor coaching to reflect the most current industry standards and interview practices. For anyone serious about advancing their career in tech, especially in roles like Technical Program Manager, Interview Kickstart provides an invaluable platform to prepare, perform, and prevail in competitive job markets.

In conclusion, if you're aiming for the top, and need a structured, insightful pathway to ace technical interviews and negotiate the best possible offers, Interview Kickstart is an investment worth considering. The impact it has had on my approach and confidence in interviews is profound, and I highly recommend their program for ambitious tech professionals.

reviews.title: IK support for my Career
reviews.text:
I am a developer working in the healthcare domain area. With my biomedical engineering background, I am not super well versed in Data structures and algorithm compared to someone with a formal "CS" college degree. The algorithm study plan helped me a lot to get the fundamentals right. Omkar's lectures have a unique ability to convey complex techniques in a simple language, which is hugely beneficial for non-CS engineers. The curriculum and the choice of problem sets with access to advanced materials , brings in a structure to my interview prep. It saved a lot of hours in deciding what is the best source from the internet and rather focusing on the concepts, not worrying about the source of information. The most I liked is the selection of problems that cover various patterns and relating them. It is very easy to get lost in leet code, trying to solve as much problems as possible, if time is infinite. For full time engineers who are looking for a structured prep, managing current job, family and a career change, IK provides a good template which will save a lot of time and put that focus.

I also wanted to share that IK support from SSA has been very positive in my experience. I had contacted them for several reasons - during lay offs too, every time they gave me a lot of options, to work with my case. Like they say, call them, you can figure out a plan !

reviews.title: Interview KickStart gives Intellectual Knowledge
reviews.text:
What I like about iK:

1. It's a great platform where you learn to think on how to code. Material is too good and deep.
2. You'll truly learn on how to answer in an interview set up.
3. 1:1 Career and coding Sessions and 1:N sessions too have been helpful.
4. iK support team actively responds and comes for help when ever a support request is raised.
5. You get to learn real time interview questions from Instructors working at FAANG companies.
Some areas I believe it can improve is:
1. It truly helps people who have a background working in the US. But, if guidance for people who should start their career in the US (have worked in different country prior and have a career gap due to relocation - as in my case) was provided - it would have been much appreciated.
2. Guidance for people who would like to transition to a level up - (Manual to Automation Testing - as in my case) if provided would have been beneficial - For example projects etc.
3. Topics of SQL and System Design, I believe should have been included in Test Engineering domain.
4. 1:1 Domain Coaching (just like 1:1 career and 1:1 coding expert connects) if provided, would have been beneficial.
5. 1:1 session time limit is too short that we can't cover everything in one go and we should wait for couple of days to book another one - However if requested for help - support team would schedule 1.

reviews.title: Comprehensive program to help ACE coding interviews
reviews.text:
I have been struggling with technical interviews at FAANG companies (Amazon and Google) for over a decade now. Every year I get recruited by Amazon, but never made it to the hiring process. It was immensely frustrating given that the companies NEVER give you the feedback, so you may know your weaknesses and work upon them.
After researching multiple tech interview preparation programs, I decided to join Interviewkickstart as they had the best reviews among others. Interview Kickstart has multiple programs and I enrolled in the BackEnd Engineering program. The program is quite comprehensive consisting of course materials, live classrooms every Sunday, homeworks, practice problems, Mock interviews, etc. In addition to covering topics thoroughly, the instructors also gave us general tactics to solve problems belonging to specific topics.
The program also covers the behavioral interview preparation and highlights key points to prepare for these types of interviews. This program provides 15 mock interviews for students which is Extremely HELPFUL, as the interviewers are often from FAANG companies like Google, Facebook or Amazon and give Detailed feedback at the end of the interview focusing on strengths and weaknesses and advice on how to improve upon weak areas. Furthermore, the program offers optional classroom sessions regarding job search, improving resume to better fit JD, negotiating salary, etc. It probably seems to be alot given practicing for coding interviews, but it is worth it.

I am currently enrolled in the Machine Learning Switch Up course, which includes over four hours of live lectures on Sundays, with instructor-led reviews and one-on-one sessions during weekdays for approximately 1 to 1.5 hours, and assignment reviews on Saturdays.

The program demands genuine commitment and is not suited for those unwilling to invest significant effort. Success in this course, like in any other endeavor, requires that students match the high level of resources and instruction provided with their own dedication and hard work.

Furthermore, the support team at Interview Kickstart deserves special mention for their exceptional service. reviews.title: An honest review of IK
reviews.text:
I joined interview kickstart in the hopes of streamlining the process of preparing for big tech interviews for me, as I do not have a lot of free-time to collate content, decide whats the most valuable content, and also study it, in between work and other duties.

I am overall greatly pleased with my decision and the IK program. The instructors are current or ex Big-Tech/FAANG employees who have first hand knowledge of the interview process at big tech, all the nuances involved from pre-application, application, recruitment, phone-screen, technical interviews, behavioral interviews, negotiation, etc.

Having access to those FAANG and Big Tech employees is, by itself, an incredibly valuable asset. However, IK also offers collated content for you to study, and teaching for the content is offered by some of these same big-tech employees.

Assignments are offered after each live sessions class for you to implement what you have just been lectured on and build a practical understanding of the material you just covered. Every week, a quiz is offered depending on what program you are in, or a review session for the assignment is held to clear up any doubts.

IK thus has a well-tuned machine that follows an academic, university like structure in how the content is taught, reinforced, and tested.

Mock Interviews are also available for you to practice interviews in real-time, in an interview like setting, to actually implement everything you have been studying and see if you are, in fact, interview ready prior to any big interviews you may have. These mock interviews are also lead by current or ex Big Tech employees.

IK is a great program, it is separate from boot-camps in that it teaches you not only the relevant content, but ties it all together to the interview process from end-to-end (the process I wrote about above).

I give the program 5 stars because I would recommend it to others, but I will also offer points of improvement so that this doesn't seem like a fake review.

For some programs, IK could offer "better" or "more relevant" content for the topic of that week. There is plenty of supplemental material which I have not reviewed, so its quite possible that content is present there, but I find that for some programs, the content could use a refresher.

Finally, student success advocates (which IK claims are offered and available) could do a much better job keeping in contact with the students.

There is no real sense of "community" at IK, so if you make the investment to join the program, realize that it is on you to be diligent about completing all assignments and attending live class sessions.

reviews.text:
I received a job offer from Meta at E5 in the Realty labs division. I was technically strong and did not need any help there. The place where I missed was always behavioral interviews. I heard a lot about IKS and called them to find out which workshop would suit me the best. Abhishek from IKS called and explained me several options and we concluded that the EM workshop with 6 behavioral mocks would be the right one and the price was 2400$. I felt it was a little high but wanted to give it a try. I went through all the videos thoroughly and the questions asked in Meta were exactly the same which means IKS instructors keep themselves up-to-date with what is being asked.

I used only 4 out of the 6 mock interviews and they were with senior leaders at Apple, Microsoft, Amazon. The feedback was very clear and I had a clear idea where I missed. I was able to control my actual interview very well and I was not at all panicked because of preparation.

Getting hired at FAANG companies is just a matter of commitment and preparation. Please spend the time and money for yourself and get a career and life that you deserve. This is my final conclusion.

Hats off to IKS and its instructors.

reviews.title: It is difficult but worth it
reviews.text:
TLDR; It is a difficult program geared to build your skills to a level where you feel comfortable presenting in an interview.

The most benefit for the buck you spent here is the organized method of attacking the interview problem both in coding, scalable design, and in my case, ML design examples. But after knowing the steps, you have to put the hours to do the work yourself, meaning leet code training, scalable design training, etc.

The examples are not always perfect, the videos are not always great, but the program as a whole is valuable nevertheless if you don't have much experience with coding and design interviews. They also do resume building and help with strategizing your calls with the coaches.

In my opinion, this program is perfect for those who have been winging it throughout their career to land on a job and wanted to apply to a bigger named company that has a standardize or test-like approach to interviewing. It is like taking a course for an SAT or ACT test. Can you do without it? yes, but if you need the help, this is one of the best out there.

In my experience, I'm taking the online-only course. It is video only with no live classes with technical coaches if I have questions. The live classes would probably better, but my schedule doesn't work out. The recordings by Omkar are very helpful for the coding sections. For someone who didn't have much design experience, the scalable design and ML design videos are super useful. But, I can see that it may not be so for those who are more experienced (and if it is you, that's a good thing, it means you're ready). I'm able to get a lot of help with my resume building. My success manager, Ajita, she was very patient in answering my questions. Due to my schedule, my learning rate is much slower than I wanted it to be, but one of the IK operations, Diksha, was able to help me to adapt the program to my needs. It was a pleasant experience overall, and if you are being reasonable, the people there are very reasonable as well, and I would highly recommend this program.

reviews.text:

They also provide mock interviews with people from FAANG-like companies, feedback, live classes, support with job search, resume, negotiation etc...

IK also has a nice feature - Career Transformation managers will guide you and help to prepare for the job search, review interview and move forward, they also will help with some career-related questions, definitely a big part of the IK program.

reviews.title: InterviewKickstart.com - Ultimate Path to Interview Success!
reviews.text:
I recently had the pleasure of enrolling in the InterviewKickstart.com online course, and I can confidently say that it's been a game-changer in my career journey. This comprehensive program not only prepares you for interviews but also equips you with valuable skills that extend beyond the interview room.

The course begins with a well-structured curriculum that covers a wide range of technical and behavioral interview topics. What truly sets InterviewKickstart.com apart is the depth and quality of the content. The instructors are industry experts, and it's evident in the way they explain complex concepts with clarity and real-world examples. The well-organized modules and comprehensive study materials make it easy to follow along and absorb the information effectively.

One of the standout features of InterviewKickstart.com is the extensive interview preparation. The mock interview sessions, coding challenges, and behavioral interview coaching were invaluable. They provided the perfect platform for me to practice and improve my interview skills, both technically and in terms of effective communication.

Another commendable aspect is the personalized feedback provided by mentors. They not only point out areas for improvement but also offer guidance on how to enhance your strengths. This individualized attention and mentorship are truly remarkable and set InterviewKickstart.com apart from other online courses.

The platform's supportive community of learners and mentors further enhances the learning experience. You can connect with peers and mentors, exchange insights, and build a network that can prove valuable in your career.

InterviewKickstart.com's commitment to staying updated with the latest industry trends and interview processes is evident. They continually update their content to ensure that students are well-prepared for the ever-evolving job market.

The platform's job placement assistance is another fantastic benefit. The team goes above and beyond to help you find job opportunities that align with your skills and career goals, making it a complete package for those looking to advance in their careers.

In summary, InterviewKickstart.com is a top-notch online course that leaves no stone unturned in preparing you for interviews and career success. The quality of instruction, personal mentorship, and extensive resources provided make it worth every penny. If you're looking to level up your interview game and land your dream job, InterviewKickstart.com is the ultimate choice. I can't recommend it highly enough!

reviews.title: Review of Interview Kickstart's Early Engineering Program
reviews.text:
Course: Interview Kickstart's Early Engineering Program
Batch: Early Feb, 2023

This course is an excellent choice for individuals preparing for technical interviews. Mr. Omkar Deshpande's foundational material was of exceptional quality. The algorithms were presented in a language-agnostic manner, making it accessible to those comfortable with any Object-Oriented Programming language.

However, the live sessions conducted by the Indian instructors left much to be desired, with the exception of Akshat, Komal, and Tarun. Their explanations were on par with that of competing Indian Ed-tech companies, which are usually poor and robotic. What was even more surprising was one of the instructors wearing a T-shirt with a logo from a competing firm during one of the live sessions.

That being said, what truly made the program valuable was gaining access to the recordings of Mr. Omkar Deshpande's live sessions. His classes were exceptional and had the power to ignite a genuine passion for Algorithms. Preparing for technical interviews can be challenging and often disheartening, but Omkar's teaching makes it a rewarding experience. I credit my software engineering career to him.

Finally, my success would not have been possible without the unwavering support of the entire team at IK Ops. In particular, I'd like to express my gratitude to Miss Kriti Mamgain, who served as my initial point of contact for any requests. It's truly remarkable to see IK Ops available to address your needs seven days a week with remarkably fast responses. They deserve as much recognition as the instructors.

I look forward to the possibility of returning to join the ML switch-up program in the near future, as long as Omkar's videos remain accessible.

reviews.title: Disappointing Experience, Lacking Results and No Refund!
reviews.text:
I had high expectations when I signed up for Interview Kickstart, having heard great things about their program. However, I am disappointed that my experience bad. The course material was lackluster and the entire program was, to be honest, quite boring.
I had hoped for an engaging and effective learning experience, but the curriculum was boring an ineffective. The sessions were monotonous, and it was difficult to stay motivated. Despite my commitment to the program, I found that the methods they used were ineffective in helping me improve my interview skills. This was not the quality I expected for the price I paid.
Adding to my frustration, Interview Kickstart did not honor their money-back guarantee. As advertised, they claim to offer a refund if you are not satisfied with the program. However, when I contacted their customer support to request a refund, I was met with multiple hurdles and uncooperative staff. Their response was slow, and I was given a runaround.
Do not buy Interview Kickstart. Their program failed to deliver results, and their customer service was unresponsive and unhelpful. Save your money and invest in a more reputable program that truly cares about its customers' success.

reviews.title: Do not waste your money

Even after training people are not responding. Whatever they teach you in a training it’s similar what you do at work. Please don’t waste your money. There other companies who provide similar training for 1000 to 1500$ and it makes sense .
